result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrell Donnell Durham

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrell D Durham appeared by video, in custody in Brown County.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Derrell D Durham.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

9:40 AM Defendant Derrell D Durham not in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Derrell D Durham.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Mr Durham has been transferred to Brown County and not scheduled to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Derrell D Durham appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms appeared by video for Derrell D Durham.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Derrell D Durham not in court.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/2/22 @ 2:30p
